snippet: The suspects studied in the United States and took jobs at the semiconductor companies Avago Technologies and Skyworks Solutions.
abstract: Obama administration announces arrest of Prof Zhang Hao and five other Chinese citizens, charging them with decade-long scheme to steal microelectronics designs on behalf of Chinese government; charges, under the Economic Espionage Act, come amid time of time of delicate relations with China, and seem meant to signal a new seriousness in pursuing those who steal American intellectual property.

byline.original: By DAVID E. SANGER and NICOLE PERLROTH
byline.contributor: David E. Sanger reported from Washington and Nicole Perlroth from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: The suspects studied in the United States and took jobs at the semiconductor companies Avago Technologies and Skyworks Solutions.

headline.main: 6 Chinese Men Indicted in Theft of Code From U.S. Tech Companies
headline.print_headline: U.S. Accuses Six Chinese in the Theft of Tech Data
